column4: I just installed ubuntu 8.04 LTS server edition on a machine i have at home, it has a network card but i dont have a eth0 interface. Whats going one?
lspci
that card might not be supported without some additional drivers.  What kind of system is it on.  Model number and such.
its found
it is found?  but doesn't give a eth0?
ifconfig -a
it shows eth0 ! O_o
does it give an IP with it?
does it give an IP with it?
nope
ifconfig eth0 auto
you would normally set a static IP for a server.
it says Host name lookup failure
you wouldn't want it wandering around when you are trying to find it.
so what should i do?
I ponder what Host name lookup failure means.
pastebin /etc/network/interfaces
that is not a command.  but a request to see that file.
PCI vid cards are handy for multiple monitor support.  As in support beyond 2 screens.
I am curious if the file is set to auto config or static IP.
i think auto config
Mine is auto and states: auto eth0 (newline) iface eth0 inet dhcp
unkmar leaves for now.  Sorry I didn't have more time to help you with your network problem.
